Author: zhyder
Content: The reason the arguing never ends is because the Mac faithful deny that a Mac is actually more expensive. No one would say "but the Solstice is the same price as the Boxster, if you just drop a more powerful engine in the Solstice..."

Author: sanj
Content:
I'm confused. My laptop is my source of earnings. Every hour I spend fiddling with it is an hour I don't get paid for.

What am I missing?

Author: greyman
Content: I think you can't go wrong with WinXP, and even Vista is OK. My friend uses it on Laptop with one-core Intel processor and 1GB ram, and he was able to configure it so it is booting and running as fast as XP.

Author: axod
Content:
If you have the money, of course you're going to spend 100x the price to get the best.

Getting a performance car isn't about the top speed, or performance in itself, it's a status symbol, a big toy, something to marvel over, something to show people, etc etc etc (I don't have one BTW.... yet).

Content: My prediction is, that Chrome will take away market share from FF, for the mere fact that they are able to inovate more rapidly than FF folks. It's very well possible that two strong players will left in the end - IE and Chrome.

Author: vaksel
Content:
the people who block advertisements won't be clicking them anyways, so the person loses nothing.

As far as Google contextual ads? They are useless in 99% of the time...just because I'm looking at a blog post describing a new TV, doesn't mean I want to buy it, from the first person who tells me they have it for sale.

If the site owner wants to make it a noble cause, then he should just throw some affiliate links to the item he discusses.
